definition: A person who is learning the alphabet or the basics of a subject.
An old-fashioned term for an umbrella.
A harsh, discordant mixture of sounds.
The act of throwing someone out of a window.
Lasting for a very short time.
The mouthpiece of a recorder or similar wind instrument.
A fine, filmy substance consisting of cobwebs spun by small spiders.
To mix socially, especially with those of higher status.
Books printed before the year 1501, in the early period of printing.
Relating to breakfast.
A commotion or fuss, especially one caused by conflicting views.
The state of being infatuated or obsessed with another person.
Sweet or musical; pleasant to hear.
Wicked or criminal in nature.
To render obscure, unclear, or unintelligible.
Having a harmful effect, especially in a gradual or subtle way.
Exceedingly idealistic; unrealistic and impractical.
A person who tells anecdotes in a skillful and amusing way.
Characterized by long words; long-winded.
The ringing or sound of bells.
